pullRequest.body:
prove that given roots a quadratic can factor to
$a(x-x1)(x-x2)$.

prove that the sum of roots of a quadratic is
$-b/a$ and the production of roots if $c/a$.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body: messageFile.md
I think these are special cases of the content of `Mathlib/RingTheory/Polynomial/Vieta.lean`. Please restate your theorems there as consequences of the arbitrary degree formulas.

> I think these are special cases of the content of `Mathlib/RingTheory/Polynomial/Vieta.lean`. Please restate your theorems there as consequences of the arbitrary degree formulas.

I have restated my theorem as a consequence of `Polynomial.coeff_eq_esymm_roots_of_card` from `Mathlib/RingTheory/Polynomial/Vieta.lean`. Please review again, thanks.
This significantly adds to the imports; see the report under "Import changes for modified files" above. Could you fix this by moving these to a later or new file?

> This significantly adds to the imports; see the report under "Import changes for modified files" above. Could you fix this by moving these to a later or new file?

Done. I have moved to a new file. Please review again, thanks a lot.

#### Declarations diff

`+ aroots_quadratic_eq_pair_iff_of_ne_zero'`
`+ eq_mul_mul_of_aroots_quadratic_eq_pair`
`+ eq_mul_mul_of_roots_quadratic_eq_pair`

`+ eq_neg_mul_add_of_roots_quadratic_eq_pair`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

`esymm_pair_one` and `esymm_pair_two` have moved to `Mathlib/RingTheory/MvPolynomial/Symmetric/Defs.lean`.
I keep the code`convert p.card_roots'; rw [hroots, Multiset.card_pair]` since `simpa [hroots] using p.card_roots'` cannot solve the goal.
Please review again, thanks.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

1. Use `x` and `y` instead of `x1` and `x2` in `esymm_pair_one` and `esymm_pair_two`. Also `{R : Type*} [CommSemiring R]` is removed.
2. The statement of `esymm_pair_one` is now `esymm (x ::â‚˜ {y}) 1 = x + y`.
3. `aroots` version is added.
4. `iff` version is added given condition `a â‰  0`.
etc

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
etc

These lemmas are misnamed; `of` means "implies" in the naming convention. They should be `esymm_pair_one` and `esymm_pair_two` and they should in another file, for example the file where `esymm` is defined.

```suggestion
    (by simpa [hroots] using p.card_roots')
```

```suggestion
  simpa [leadingCoeff, hp_natDegree, p, hroots, mul_assoc, add_comm x1] using
    And.intro (coeff_eq_esymm_roots_of_card hp_roots_card (k := 1) (by norm_num [hp_natDegree]))
      (coeff_eq_esymm_roots_of_card hp_roots_card (k := 0) (by norm_num [hp_natDegree]))
```

```suggestion
-- TODO: `Multiset.insert_eq_cons` being simp means that `esymm {x1, x2}` is not simp normal form
@[simp] lemma esymm_pair_one {R : Type*} [CommSemiring R] (x1 x2 : R) :
    esymm (x1 ::â‚˜ {x2}) 1 = x2 + x1 := by
  simp [esymm, powersetCard_one]

@[simp] lemma esymm_pair_two {R : Type*} [CommSemiring R] (x1 x2 : R) :
    esymm (x1 ::â‚˜ {x2}) 2 = x1 * x2 := by
  simp [esymm, powersetCard_one]
```
Annoyingly, `Multiset.insert_eq_cons` works against the nice `{x1, x2}` notation...

```suggestion
    esymm (x1 ::â‚˜ {x2}) 1 = x1 + x2 := by
```
seems better
Could you use `a` and `b` or `x` and `y` instead of `x1` and `x2`? Also,`{R : Type*} [CommSemiring R]` is already declared in this section, no need to repeat it
Can you add the `aroots`  version too?
Is this statement true as an `iff`?
It's a little unusual to have a theorem whose conclusion is an `And`; perhaps this should be two separate lemmas, `eq_mul_add_of_roots_eq_pair` and `eq_mul_mul_of_roots_eq_pair`?
It looks fine to split `quadratic_vieta` into two lemmas. And it seems that I should change the name of all the lemmas to descriptive name. Should I?
`And` is now splitted into 2 lemmas. All lemmas are renamed.
Rather than creating a private lemma, I think you should just inline the former into the latter.

`roots_of_ne_zero_of_vieta` is used by `quadratic_vieta_iff_of_ne_zero` and `quadratic_vieta_aroots_iff_of_ne_zero`.
Should I inline `roots_of_ne_zero_of_vieta` to both lemmas?
You can use the non-aroots `Iff` version to prove the aroots version.
Ok. I have done.

```suggestion
/-- **Vieta's formula** for quadratic (`aroots` version). -/
```

```suggestion
/-- **Vieta's formula** for quadratics as an iff. -/
```

pullRequest.title: feat: Vieta's formula for quadratic polynomial
